abstract: Represents a selection of attributed text.
overview:
## Overview

A selection is either an insertion point (e.g. a cursor in the text), or spans over a range of characters. While that range is always visually contiguous, it may not be logically contiguous in the text storage. Specifically, a single selection value cannot represent multiple cursors.

This is frequently used to represent selection of text in a `TextEditor`. The following example shows a text editor that leverages text selection to offer live suggestions based on the current selection.

You can also use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/textSelectionAffinity(_:)] modifier to specify a selection affinity on the given hierarchy:

items.description: A sequence of all attribute values a selection has in a certain text.
items.name: AttributedTextSelection.Attributes

items.description: Initialize the default selection for a new text editor.
items.name: init()

items.description: Initialize a selection to a single insertion point.
items.name: init(insertionPoint:typingAttributes:)

items.description: Initialize a selection to a character range.
items.name: init(range:)

items.description: Initialize a selection to character ranges.
items.name: init(ranges:)

items.description: Return the selection affinity of the selection.
items.name: affinity(in:)

items.description: Obtain a lazy sequence of all attribute values the selection has in a given text.
items.name: attributes(in:)

items.description: Returns the typing attributes for a corresponding text.
items.name: typingAttributes(in:)

items.description: The indices of the current selection.
items.name: AttributedTextSelection.Indices

items.description: Controls whether people can select text within this view.
items.name: textSelection(_:)

items.description: A type that describes the ability to select text.
items.name: TextSelectability

items.description: Sets the direction of a selection or cursor relative to a text character.
items.name: textSelectionAffinity(_:)

items.description: A representation of the direction or association of a selection or cursor relative to a text character. This concept becomes much more prominent when dealing with bidirectional text (text that contains both LTR and RTL scripts, like English and Arabic combined).
items.name: textSelectionAffinity

items.description: A representation of the direction or association of a selection or cursor relative to a text character. This concept becomes much more prominent when dealing with bidirectional text (text that contains both LTR and RTL scripts, like English and Arabic combined).
items.name: TextSelectionAffinity

title: AttributedTextSelection
